framework::App Class Reference
[Simple application framework]

#include <App.h>

List of all members.

Detailed Description

Base class for application instances.

There must be only one application instance. Application instance must always be allocated to heap (with operator new).


Public Types

Member Enumeration Documentation

enum framework::App::KeyType
 

Key type.

Enumeration values:
KEY_LEFT  Arrow left.
KEY_RIGHT  Arrow right.
KEY_UP  Arrow up.
KEY_DOWN  Arrow down.
KEY_LBUTTON  Left mouse button.
KEY_MBUTTON  Middle mouse button.
KEY_RBUTTON  Right mouse button.

Member Function Documentation

bool framework::App::initialized (   )  [static]
 

Returns true if App has been initialized.

bool framework::App::isKeyDown (  KeyType  key  )  const
 

Returns true if specified key is currently pressed down.

State returned by this function is updated in default keyEvent implementation.

virtual void framework::App::keyDown (  KeyType  key  )  [virtual]
 

Called when user pressed key down.

Default implementation updates state returned by isKeyDown and handles pause key so that update receives dt=0 if pause is enabled.

virtual void framework::App::keyUp (  KeyType  key  )  [virtual]
 

Called when user releases key.

Default implementation updates state returned by isKeyDown and handles pause key so that update receives dt=0 if pause is enabled.

void framework::App::loadShaders (  const lang::String &  path,
bool  recursesubdirs
) 
 

Loads all shaders from specific directory.

After this the application can refer to the shader with its basename. For example after loading "high-end-shaders/bumpspecular.fx" application can simply request "bumpspecular" shader and get an instance of the previously loaded shader.

virtual void framework::App::mouseMove (  int  dx,
int  dy
)  [virtual]
 

Called when user moves the mouse.

If mouse has been captured (config.captureMouse=true in App init() function), then relative coordinates are received. Otherwise the coordinates are absolute, in window client area.

lang::String framework::App::path (  const lang::String &  filename = ""  )  const
 

Returns expanded default path to data files.

bool framework::App::paused (   )  const [inline]
 

Returns true if application is paused.

bool framework::App::playingInput (   )  const
 

Returns true if application is playing back key presses and mouse input.

See also:
playInput

void framework::App::playInput (  const lang::String &  filename  ) 
 

Playback of key-press and mouse input from specified file.

Can be used to make simple repeats/recordings. Note: Recordings do NOT match exactly the original due to variable frame rate, so do not use this method in actual game to make a recording functionality.

void framework::App::quit (   ) 
 

Request application exit.

bool framework::App::quitRequested (   )  const [inline]
 

Returns true if application has requested exit.

bool framework::App::recordingInput (   )  const
 

Returns true if application is recording key presses and mouse input.

See also:
recordInput

void framework::App::recordInput (  const lang::String &  filename  ) 
 

Enables key-press and mouse input recording to specified file.

Can be used to make simple repeats/recordings. Note: Recordings do NOT match exactly the original due to variable frame rate, so do not use this method in actual game to make a recording functionality.

void framework::App::setDataPath (  const lang::String &  datapath  ) 
 

Sets default data path.

Stops playing back buffered keys and mouse movements.

Stops buffering keys and mouse movements.

gr::Context *  context
)  [virtual]
 

Main loop for your application.

Parameters:
dt Time (seconds) since last update.
